description:
OpenStack listens to requests over the network, and (when appropriate)
performs operations on the host that require root superpowers. Following
best-practice design, most of the code runs as an unprivileged user and
only the code that needs additional powers runs as root using a tool
called "rootwrap".

This talk discusses the evolution that led to the current rootwrap
design, why it has proven to be completely inadequate in practice, and
presents a new "privsep" alternative currently being worked on within
Oslo.
title: Privsep: A New Security Isolation Mechanism for OpenStack
